turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Discworld characters.
turn.1: What is the role of Roland in "Wintersmith"?
turn.2: In "Wintersmith", Roland was reluctantly recruited by the Nac Mac Feegle to perform the role of the mythic Hero in the Dance of the Seasons, to put right the damage Tiffany had caused by interfering in the dance and the proper roles of the Wintersmith and the Summer Lady.
turn.3: How does he react to this?
turn.4: Against all expectations, he acquitted himself admirably.
turn.6: There are signs that his feelings for Tiffany extend somewhat beyond gratitude.
turn.7: What are some of the signs?
turn.8: He also gave Tiffany a box of watercolors, one of which was turquoise, allegedly very expensive on the Discworld.
turn.9: Is there anything else interesting about Roland's role in the seasons?
turn.10: When Tiffany went to Lancre to study witchcraft in "A Hat Full of Sky", Roland gave her a silver necklace in the image of the giant white horse that is carved into the Chalk; Tiffany uses the necklace as a symbol to draw on the power of her homeland in times of crisis.
turn.12: By the fourth book in the series, "I Shall Wear Midnight", Roland and Tiffany have realised that simply being different from those around them does not mean they are similar, and Roland decides to marry Letitia Keepsake, a good-natured if somewhat pampered aristocrat.
